intro: Thesium parnassi, commonly known as the Parnassian thesium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Ericaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of the western United States, particularly in California and Oregon. The plant is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit and its clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a dense layer of fine, white hairs. Thesium parnassi thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes.
